text: The Man Who Planted Trees () is a 1987 Canadian short animated movie directed by Frédéric Back. It is based on Jean Giono's 1953 short story The Man Who Planted Trees. The movie was 30 minutes and had a French and English version. The movie was narrated by actors Philippe Noiret in French and Christopher Plummer in English. The movie won the Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film in 1988. ==References== Category:1987 movies Category:Canadian animated movies Category:Short movies Category:Academy Award winning movies
